trans-unit.source: Get Started with Azure Mobile Services for HTML 5 apps
trans-unit.target: Get Started with Azure Mobile Services for HTML 5 apps

trans-unit.source: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Services for HTML development.
trans-unit.target: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Services for HTML development.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to an HTML app using Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to an HTML app using Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will create both a new mobile service and a simple To do list app that stores app data in the new mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will create both a new mobile service and a simple To do list app that stores app data in the new mobile service.

trans-unit.source: You can view the following video version of this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You can view the following video version of this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: A screenshot from the completed app is below:
trans-unit.target: A screenshot from the completed app is below:

trans-unit.source: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Mobile Services tutorials for HTML apps.
trans-unit.target: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Mobile Services tutorials for HTML apps.

trans-unit.source: For a PhoneGap/Cordova app, see the the <linkText>PhoneGap/Cordova version</linkText><title></title> of this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: For a PhoneGap/Cordova app, see the the <linkText>PhoneGap/Cordova version</linkText><title></title> of this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: The following are required to complete this tutorial:
trans-unit.target: The following are required to complete this tutorial:

trans-unit.source: You must have one of the following web servers running on your local computer:
trans-unit.target: You must have one of the following web servers running on your local computer:

trans-unit.source: On Windows: IIS Express.
trans-unit.target: On Windows: IIS Express.

trans-unit.source: IIS Express is installed by the [Microsoft Web Platform Installer].
trans-unit.target: IIS Express is installed by the [Microsoft Web Platform Installer].

trans-unit.source: On MacOS X: Python, which should already be installed.
trans-unit.target: On MacOS X: Python, which should already be installed.

trans-unit.source: On Linux: Python.
trans-unit.target: On Linux: Python.

trans-unit.source: You must install the [latest version of Python].
trans-unit.target: You must install the [latest version of Python].

trans-unit.source: You can use any web server to host the app, but these are the web servers that are supported by the downloaded scripts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any web server to host the app, but these are the web servers that are supported by the downloaded scripts.

trans-unit.source: A web browser that supports HTML5.
trans-unit.target: A web browser that supports HTML5.

trans-unit.source: An Azure account.
trans-unit.target: An Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mcid=A0E0E5C02&returnurl=http%3A%2F%2Fazure.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fdevelop%2Fmobile%2Ftutorials%2Fget-started-html%2F"%20target="blank).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mcid=A0E0E5C02&returnurl=http%3A%2F%2Fazure.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fdevelop%2Fmobile%2Ftutorials%2Fget-started-html%2F"%20target="blank).

trans-unit.source: Once you have created your mobile service, you can follow an easy quickstart in the Management Portal to either create a new app or modify an existing app to connect to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Once you have created your mobile service, you can follow an easy quickstart in the Management Portal to either create a new app or modify an existing app to connect to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In this section you will create a new HTML app that is connected to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In this section you will create a new HTML app that is connected to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click Mobile Services, and then click the mobile service that you just created.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click Mobile Services, and then click the mobile service that you just created.

trans-unit.source: In the quickstart tab, click Windows under Choose platform and expand Create a new HTML app.
trans-unit.target: In the quickstart tab, click Windows under Choose platform and expand Create a new HTML app.

trans-unit.source: This displays the three easy steps to create and host an HTML app connected to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This displays the three easy steps to create and host an HTML app connected to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Click Create TodoItems table to create a table to store app data.
trans-unit.target: Click Create TodoItems table to create a table to store app data.

trans-unit.source: Under Download and run your app, click Download.
trans-unit.target: Under Download and run your app, click Download.

trans-unit.source: This downloads the website files for the sample To do list application that is connected to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This downloads the website files for the sample To do list application that is connected to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Save the compressed file to your local computer, and make a note of where you save it.
trans-unit.target: Save the compressed file to your local computer, and make a note of where you save it.

trans-unit.source: In the Configure tab, verify that localhost is already listed in the Allow requests from host names list under Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS).
trans-unit.target: In the Configure tab, verify that localhost is already listed in the Allow requests from host names list under Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS).

trans-unit.source: If it's not, type localhost in the Host name field and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: If it's not, type localhost in the Host name field and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: If you deploy the quickstart app to a web server other than localhost, you must add the host name of the web server to the Allow requests from host names list.
trans-unit.target: If you deploy the quickstart app to a web server other than localhost, you must add the host name of the web server to the Allow requests from host names list.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Cross-origin resource sharing</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Cross-origin resource sharing</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The final stage of this tutorial is to host and run your new app on your local computer.
trans-unit.target: The final stage of this tutorial is to host and run your new app on your local computer.

trans-unit.source: Browse to the location where you saved the compressed project files, expand the files on your computer, and launch one of the following command files from the server subfolder.
trans-unit.target: Browse to the location where you saved the compressed project files, expand the files on your computer, and launch one of the following command files from the server subfolder.

trans-unit.source: launch-windows (Windows computers)
trans-unit.target: launch-windows (Windows computers)

trans-unit.source: launch-mac.command (Mac OS X computers)
trans-unit.target: launch-mac.command (Mac OS X computers)

trans-unit.source: launch-linux.sh (Linux computers)
trans-unit.target: launch-linux.sh (Linux computers)

trans-unit.source: On a Windows computer, type R when PowerShell asks you to confirm that you want to run the script.
trans-unit.target: On a Windows computer, type R when PowerShell asks you to confirm that you want to run the script.

trans-unit.source: Your web browser might warn you to not run the script because it was downloaded from the internet.
trans-unit.target: Your web browser might warn you to not run the script because it was downloaded from the internet.

trans-unit.source: When this happens, you must request that the browser proceed to load the script.
trans-unit.target: When this happens, you must request that the browser proceed to load the script.

trans-unit.source: This starts a web server on your local computer to host the new app.
trans-unit.target: This starts a web server on your local computer to host the new app.

trans-unit.source: Open the URL http://localhost:8000/ in a web browser to start the app.
trans-unit.target: Open the URL http://localhost:8000/ in a web browser to start the app.

trans-unit.source: In the app, type meaningful text, such as Complete the tutorial, in Enter new task, and then click Add.
trans-unit.target: In the app, type meaningful text, such as Complete the tutorial, in Enter new task, and then click Add.

trans-unit.source: This sends a POST request to the new mobile service hosted in Azure.
trans-unit.target: This sends a POST request to the new mobile service hosted in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Data from the request is inserted into the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: Data from the request is inserted into the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: Items stored in the table are returned by the mobile service, and the data is displayed in the second column in the app.
trans-unit.target: Items stored in the table are returned by the mobile service, and the data is displayed in the second column in the app.

trans-unit.source: You can review the code that accesses your mobile service to query and insert data, which is found in the app.js file.
trans-unit.target: You can review the code that accesses your mobile service to query and insert data, which is found in the app.js file.

trans-unit.source: Back in the Management Portal, click the Data tab and then click the TodoItems table.
trans-unit.target: Back in the Management Portal, click the Data tab and then click the TodoItems table.

trans-unit.source: This lets you browse the data inserted by the app into the table.
trans-unit.target: This lets you browse the data inserted by the app into the table.

trans-unit.source: Now that you have completed the quickstart, learn how to perform additional important tasks in Mobile Services:
trans-unit.target: Now that you have completed the quickstart, learn how to perform additional important tasks in Mobile Services:

trans-unit.source:
[Get started with data]
Learn more about storing and querying data using Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target:
[Get started with data]
Learn more about storing and querying data using Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source:
[Call a custom API from an HTML application]
Connect your HTML application with a custom API hosted on Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target:
[Call a custom API from an HTML application]
Connect your HTML application with a custom API hosted on Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source:
[Get started with authentication]
Learn how to authenticate users of your app with an identity provider.
trans-unit.target:
[Get started with authentication]
Learn how to authenticate users of your app with an identity provider.

trans-unit.source:
[Mobile Services HTML/JavaScript How-to Conceptual Reference]
Learn more about how to use Mobile Services with HTML/JavaScript
trans-unit.target:
[Mobile Services HTML/JavaScript How-to Conceptual Reference]
Learn more about how to use Mobile Services with HTML/JavaScript
